description: This top-floor, renovated 2 BR/ 2 BATHROOM is located in Dunolly Gardens,a 1938 building complex with one of the prettiest and largest gardens in the Historic District of Jackson Heights. If you are looking for charm, great light, and peace and quiet, this apartment is your match! The updated kitchen has stainless steel appliances and granite counter tops. The adjacent dining room converts to a third bedroom. There is eastern/western/northern light exposures, high ceilings, and hardwood floors. The year-round Farmer's Market is a block away and it is a quick walk to the subway (E/F/M/R/7 trains) which gets you to the east side of Manhattan in just three stops. There is storage, bike storage, a live-in super, and an onsite managing agent. The complex also offers onsite electronic and textile recycling, and composting. Pet friendly!

description:
Located in the Financial District, Four Points By Sheraton New York Downtown features smoke-free accommodations, on-site restaurant, and rooftop bar. The hotel is 350 metres from Wall Street and the New York Stock Exchange.

With private bathrooms and air conditioning, guestrooms offer a flat-screen TV, safe, and workspace. Bottled water and coffee are provided free. Upgraded suites include a sleeper sofa and sitting area.

Guests can enjoy a workout in the fitness centre or use the business centre to stay in touch with the office. Meeting facilities and luggage storage are also available. Valet parking is accessible nearby (fee).

The Ketch Brewhouse serves American cuisine and specialises in craft beers. Located on the 29th floor, the rooftop bar offers impressive views of the Brooklyn Bridge and Lower Manhattan.

Four Points By Sheraton New York Downtown is 300 metres from South Street Seaport and 700 metres from the 9/11 Memorial. Wall St. and Fulton St. subway stations are less than five minutes away

After 4 years I need to move out of my beautiful room in Greenpoint. The room fits a full size bed, dresser & nightstand. There is also your own entrance to the room from the hallway if needed.

The room is in an amazing 5 bedroom apartment with awesome roommates, spacious & updated kitchen, living room and bathroom. The roommates (2 male / 2 female) are mid-late 20s, respectful of eachother's space and help take care of household chores. Some of them travel quite frequently so it never really feels like a full house. Looking for females only. Also, no pets or smoking inside.

The location cannot be beat as there is a laundromat across the street, restaurants and bars steps away, 24 hour Rite Aid around the corner (& basically anything else you could ever need!). Greenpoint G stop is 3 blocks north while Nassau G stop is 3 blocks south. The L at Bedford Ave. is also a quick 10-15 minute walk. As I write this, I realize I will miss it. ❤

description:
**Hello ! 

I am looking to fill a bedroom in my large four bedroom apartment for June 1st for at least 3- 6 months, month to month, maybe longer. The bedroom available is unfunished, high ceilings, two window and built in closet. The room can fit a full size bed and some furniture, lots of potential. 

* Please note that the room is directly above my bedroom. I live on the lower level and moderate to loud noise ( walking briskly, running, thumping) can be heard to more of an effect. I am looking for someone who can respect that fully. The apartment is quiet, meaning we are all quiet people and keep to ourselves mostly. 

We are friendly, creative and mature adults. I am an artist and the two other females are artist as well. We are all in our 30's and would like to find someone in the same age group. We are a quiet, respectable working bunch who want the same for a roomie. The apartment has a large kitchen, and two full bathrooms and small living area, and a nook for bikes. The bathrooms upstairs are shared by two other roommates, I have my own in the lower level.

We are off the JMZ Kosciuskzco stop at Myrtle Broadway. The neighborhood has changed and the apartment is close to laundry, bodega's a large supermarket and small organic market and local bars and coffee shops. 

I am looking for someone who is responsible, mature and can pay rent on time! and respectable of the space and not looking to turn it into a hostel. Someone who has house pride, willing to clean when needed and take out the trash from time to time. 

The move in fees are first month's $750 and $350 security. We have internet, no cable. Heat and hot water & internet included. Electricity varies it can run from $25 up depending on usage -AC, space Heater etc...Windows in the room for an AC. 

Please email the above link if you are interested and please state a little about yourself. 
Sorry no pets, there is already a cat named jack.. 

* Also an earlier move in date can be arranged April 25th with a pro rated 1st month. 

I will be showing mainly on weekend until I find someone. I will start showing the weekends in April  2018. Please let me know if you can make it between the times of 2-3pm on Sat or Sundays. I may be able to accommodate some weekdays as well. Let me know when you will like to stop by.**
title: -Charming bedroom available in large 4 bdr apt. Available May 1st 2018

description:
**Hey there! I'm looking to extend my stay in France if I can find a subletter to fill the room -- Orginally I was only going to be gone 2 weeks and didnt think subletting was worth it, but now that I can stay longer, it'd be a good deal for someone -- if you need a whole month, the dates can be flexible as I haven't booked my return leg yet.

My roommate can show you the place if you'd like and I left it ready for someone in case this happened --there's bedding, shelving and underbed storage for you -- I put all my stuff in the closest so you just wouldn't have access to that.

More info:

The private room and whole apartment are huge, getting tons of natural light from the loft windows overlooking Bedford ave in the best location in Williamsburg at N 5th st, 2 blocks from the L train to Manhattan. The room is extremely spacious with an exposed brick lounge corner and desk if you need to get anything done.

The living room has a great record collection and projector for any movie nights you may want to have, streaming from Roku and AppleTV. The kitchen has a big island bar if you're into cooking and roof access has sweet views of Manhattan. The loft is on the third of five floors of a converted brassiere factory building.

The location is right in the middle of Williamsburg with tons of cafes, shops, restaurants, groceries, bars, music/movie venues, etc. just outside, even an independent bookstore that Amazon hasn't made extinct right below your room.

The Apartment is a 3 bedroom, 1 bathroom. My roommates, Simone and Jason, shower early and are usually out the door to their full-time jobs by 8:30am. They're both super friendly and we've all lived together for over 2 years now.

Other stuff I can think of:

Simone sometimes hosts a potluck dinner at the apt so you might have to eat some delicious food if you're around. (a tough ask I know)

There's a drop off laundry on the block or a normal laundromat a block and a half away.

Groceries like Foodtown, Whole Foods and Duane Reade are all 1 block away.

We're plant-friendly as you can tell from the photos!

Having guests is cool, but hoping you don't throw any giant ragers.

Just respond with your info any questions - and I can arrange for Simone to connect with you

Brian**

description:
**This is a room in Park Slope, near the 4th/9th and 7th ave subway stops (F,G, and R trains). The apartment is huge. It's the top 3 floors of a brownstone, and this room is on top so there is little street noise. It is over 200 sq ft. It's actually two rooms with the wall knocked out. Minimal noise and lots of natural light. Two closets in the room.

You'd be living with 3 roommates, 3 full bathrooms, and a backyard space with a garden. The ground floor is all shared space: a kitchen, living room, and dining room. The top two floors are the bedrooms. This place has really an odd amount of space for a New York apartment. The place is great for hosting people since the first floor is shared and has tons of room. It also has a great location: across the street from a grocery store and 24 hour pharmacy. A block from the subway. 

As for me, I'm a 37 year old freelance media producer. I host the occasional dinner party or Groupmuse concert. I'm big on sharing, so if you have plants you want to put in common spaces or have other ideas for making the place nice, that's good too. We don't need to be good friends, but ideally you are someone who enjoys people and chatting in the kitchen. 

We're looking for someone for May 1. I'll need one months rent as a deposit to secure the place.

House is queer/420 friendly. Sadly, no pets or smokers per landlord rules. If interested, write me back with some information about yourself and your experience living with other people.**

description:
Large birds of prey, Blue Birds and Cardinals regularly fly by and land on the apple tree right in front of the house. The house and grounds are on the site of a former horse farm. If you like beautiful panoramic views of the Catskill Mountains look no further. The sunrises and sunsets are spectacular.

The house is situated on a hill overlooking the Mohonk Mountain monument and Shwangunk Ridge in Ulster County, New York. The living room, dinning area, large deck and Master Bedroom face the mountain range. The Master bedroom suite also has a private bathroom and a Jacuzzi tub. The downstairs bedroom faces west towards the Sundown Wild Forest. The Finished basement has a bedroom suite with 2 bedrooms, living room, bathroom, and separate entrance which also is accessible from the house. 

Enjoy a shaded porch with a wicker living room set, outdoor dinning table, gas grill and Charcoal Grill. All of this faces the mountain range. There are hiking trails right from the house as well as, Lake Minnewaska, Mohonk Mountain house and preserve, Sundown Wild Forest. There is also Lippman Park in Ellenville, which has a large selection of Mountain Bike paths. Tubing is located in Phoenicia, NY. 

Restaurants close to the house (5 min) - Arrowood Farms Brewery, Westwinds Orchard, Roundout Valley Golf Course, and The Country Inn. New Paltz, Kingston, Woodstock New York, are 40 minutes away.
Ideal for large, small or medium families or lovers of peace quiet and privacey, 
one queen bed, 2 full size beds and 2 couches.

description:
Hi,

June 1st - Move-in for a Furnished or Unfurnished room available for Fourth Roommate to sublease 6 months-1 year. 

We are three roommates who have been living with each other in the same place for the past four years and are ready for a change/new apartment. We're looking for a new fourth roommate to join us in our new apartment as our original roommate will be heading back home. 

We're in our late 20s. We've had a pretty relaxed and spacious place/environment with constant good vibes we'd like to keep into the new place. We all work in the entertainment industry. There's a cat here, he's a little too social, but pretty chill and sleeps more then we do. Very 420. Open-minded and open to all. We all work full-time, so constantly in and out of the house, business-traveling across country etc.. We like to have people over especially during football season (Watching games, Madden, You don't have to like football to hang out) dinner, watch movies/wine and those sort of things (We have a sweet home theatre set-up). We want it to be a place to come home to and decompress/relax and you're always welcome to have guests over. 

About you: Open to all. We've had multiple sublets that we're still friends with that have been male, female, international, artists. It's a great environment for anyone new to the city or international or just anyone needing a temporary longer place while they transition or visiting for a year etc. Again there is a cat that lives here, so must be okay with cats. We're 420 and smoke around the house. 

We have a few prospective places we're solidifying on which are in Bushwick/Flatbush on The J/L Line and in Sunset Park/Bay Ridge area closer to Prospect Park on the N/R/W Line. These are the areas we'd like to stay in. The new place would be just as spacious as the one we have now with two bathrooms, duplex-style. You'd be subleasing and looking for at least a 6 month sublet to a year sublet with a move in date of June 1st. Rent will be anywhere from $600-$700 max plus Electric, Gas, Internet utilities. 

We have extra bedroom furniture: Bed, Desks, etc. You'd definitely be able to use if needing a furnished room. 

Email us about yourself (Career/What do you like to use your free time doing?), Let us know you're ready to move in June 1st, income/job and links to social media (make sure you're not a robot) and we'll reach out to  see about visiting our current place and meeting everyone to see if it'd be a good fit and schedule a showing of the new place/help input on deciding on new apartment if we haven't selected yet. First month's rent & security deposit before move in. $1200-$1400 total. We'll start scheduling to meet people beginning of May. 

Thanks!
title: Fourth Roommate to join sublease apartment - June 1st - Can Furnish

description:
My name is Robert Bashura and I am seeking a stable roommate situation in a place that I can "call home."  My good friend (moving back here from Dallas, Tx) and I are looking for a temporary (w/in 3 mths) place to cohabitate in the city while we find a permanent apartment.  He (55) is just like me in many ways and we would share the same room, the only difference is that he has his own business, working for private clients as a PA, so his hours vary.  We both have our major belongings in storage units, so we would only be bringing what is necessary to accomplish our "task at hand" into the living situation.  I like to have all utilities & wifi included the monthly rent and also desire to be close to either the D,N,R trains if at all possible.
     I am a "young" 57 year old single gay white man who is employed full time in the decorative painting field in Brooklyn.  My work hours are M-F, 8:30a - 5:30p with an occasional Saturday.  When not at work, I have many "interests" and enjoy being "out and about" in this amazing city.
     I am "easy going," responsible, social, friendly and can carry on an intelligent conversation, a social drinker (not to excess) and non-smoker, but am ok with people who do smoke.  I love most types of music but have grown out of listening to it in my personal life.  So now, at my age, I live a quiet lifestyle and prefer to have the same when I am home  I also love all types of pets, have had many over the years, but do not have or plan to acquire any.  
     I do enjoy having use of the kitchen, doing light cooking to be able to eat healthy.  Therefore, I would require refrigerator and cabinet space, but will need to share the cooking utensils etc.  I have worked around the restaurant industry for years and understand how to not make a mess and clean as I go.
     Now, concerning shared space, I am a fastidious individual who enjoys order and cleanliness, but understand that people have different levels of what's ok.  I am more than willing to "pitch-in" but, don't want to be a "parent" when it comes to cleaning.  I do not own (nor do I want to acquire) a lot of things, basically have a TV, laptop / printer and cloths.  I also don't want to be a "hermit" in my room, so I would like the freedom to enjoy the living area at times, both personally and occasionally with friends. 
     I have put forth an honest synopsis of myself and if you feel like you would like to speak further, please let me know via the methods provided below.

Sincerely,

Robert Bashura
 
 
 
 (preferred contact method)
title: 2 Gay men seeking a 3-6 month domicile

     I am "easy going," responsible, social, friendly and can carry on an intelligent conversation, a social drinker (not to excess) and non-smoker, but am ok with people who do smoke.  I love most types of music but have grown out of listening to it in my personal life.  So now, at my age, I live a quiet lifestyle and prefer to have the same when I am home  I also love all types of pets, have had many over the years, but do not have or plan to acquire any.  
     I do enjoy having use of the kitchen, doing light cooking to be able to eat healthy.  Therefore, I would require refrigerator and cabinet space, but will need to share the cooking utensils etc.  I have worked around the restaurant industry for years and understand how to not make a mess and clean as I go.
     Now, concerning shared space, I am a fastidious individual who enjoys order and cleanliness, but understand that people have different levels of what's ok.  I am more than willing to "pitch-in" but, don't want to be a "parent" when it comes to cleaning.  I do not own (nor do I want to acquire) a lot of things, basically have a TV, laptop / printer and cloths.  I also don't want to be a "hermit" in my room, so I would like the freedom to enjoy the living area at times, both personally and occasionally with friends. 
     I have put forth an honest synopsis of myself and if you feel like you would like to speak further, please let me know via the methods provided below.

Sincerely,

Robert Bashura
 
 
 
 (preferred contact method)
